item.title: Which Famous Character Are You Today?
item.dc:creator: Elizabeth Bastos
item.description:
My son, 8, is in to action figures. He pretends he is Spider Man. I can relate. In my own bookish nerdish did you read the latest New Yorker? way. What I am into is pretending to be famous characters from literature. They are my version of action heroes. I adopt what like best about [...]

item.title: Amazon and Goodreads: One User’s Response
item.dc:creator: Amanda Nelson
item.description:
Goodreads announced yesterday that it has been bought by Amazon. The immediate response on the bookternet (or at least my corner of it) was shock and a fair bit of outrage/disappointment. The response on Goodreads’ announcement and in their Feedback forum has been overwhelmingly and surprisingly negative. As happens with any big change to something [...]

item.title: Will You Be Deleting Your Goodreads Account?
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Joines Schinsky
item.description:

item.title: Amazon Acquires Goodreads : Readers React
item.dc:creator: Cassandra Neace
item.description:
On Thursday afternoon, Twitter exploded with reactions to the news that one of (if not THE) most popular social reading sites, Goodreads, was purchased by Amazon. Reactions to this news were fairly consistent, and almost entirely negative.

item.description:
This round of Name Those Authors! is sponsored by Angelopolis by Danielle Trussoni. A New York Times bestseller and global sensation, Angelology unfurled a brilliant tapestry of myth and biblical lore on our present-day world and plunged two star-crossed heroes into an ancient battle against mankind’s greatest enemy: the fatally attractive angel-human hybrids known as the Nephilim.
